section.section:
A licensee may provide to a consumer the materials required under paragraph (1)(ii) of this subsection using the Internet if:
A debt management counselor of the licensee has reviewed and approved the computer program or application used to create the financial analysis and initial budget plan; and
The consumer is:
Title 21 of the Commercial Law Article applies to the provision of materials and associated transactions under this paragraph.

In addition to the requirements under paragraph (1) of this subsection, before providing debt management services for a consumer, a debt management services provider shall provide a written notice to the consumer stating:
That if the consumer elects to file for bankruptcy, the consumer will be required under federal bankruptcy law to receive pre-bankruptcy credit counseling services from a nonprofit credit counseling agency that is approved by the United States Trustee Program;
Whether the debt management services provider is approved by the United States Trustee Program to provide pre-bankruptcy credit counseling services; and
That the consumer should contact a federal bankruptcy court to obtain a list of credit counseling agencies that are approved by the United States Trustee Program.

text.section: A debt management services agreement between a consumer and a person that is not a licensee under this subtitle shall be null and void, and all fees paid to the person under the debt management services agreement shall be recoverable by the consumer, together with reasonable attorney's fees.
